comment: Yes, these are college courses, not high school classes.  If you are taking them because they are easy then you are not learning anything!  I took Mr. Lindsay for Comp 1, Comp 2 and World Lit 226.  Yes, he was tough and we had to do a lot of reading and writing.  Of all my college courses, I learned the most from him and I use what he taught daily!
GREAT WHEN GIVING YOU A REGENTS TEST.
AWSOME TEACHER, I wanted to do well in this class

Special Topic Class: writing on Social Conscience. Great teacher. He makes you do a lot of work that, at first, seems a bit odd, but when you do it all, there is a connection between it all. On of the few classes I looked forward to going to each day. I recommend taking him.
He really make you think about what you are writing.  I learned a lot in this class.  Good teacher.

Obsessed with fame for himself. Class focused more on good deeds for the community with random essays based on whims here and there. No learning. Very Disappointing. Grades based on his opinion. If you disagree with him, you fail. Pushover.

GIVES WAY TO MUCH WORK!!!  he really has a passion for what his teachings.  He gives some assigments that make no sense at all, but if you do your work and make it look like you put effort into, youll make a good grade. Also, stay on top of your work and it dosent hurt to suck up to him.

Lindsay has a passion for what he's doing. He really wants his students to do well and that's why i htink he gives the crazy assignments. but he is willing to help if you ask for it. you can't just blow the class off and expect to do well. show up, be nice, and he will do the same. he's always prepared!

This is a good professor he is very eager to help students.  I am horrible at english classes but his where great.  I got an A in both 1101 and 1102.  I dont see how any of the other posters did so bad.  Like others have said you have to stay current on his work which is not hard.  These are freshmen classes in college not high school.

OK here's the deal with him! You need to stay on top of your work and not fall behind.He's a nice guy. the only reason people dont like him is cause he gives alot of work and they fall behind. just stay current on your work and you'll do fine.
the man is the worst teacher. gave stupid assignments. if you go to his office he will think you try and give you good grades.

While I understand his wishes for students to dig deeper, his assignments were uncessecarily vauge and frustrating.  Add to this the fact that the grading system is an enigma, and it's a recipie for disaster!  If playing Russian roulette with your GPA sounds appealing, then good luck.
Dont take him for this class! Take Morrow or Stevenson! This guy is rediculus hated his class doesnt make it the least bit interesting or motivated. took the same class with morrow and loved it.
DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM!

Very good professor.  You get out of his class what you put into it.  If you listen to his ideas and where he is looking for you to go with your writings then the assignments are simple and take at most an hour.  Simple assignments if you listen in class.

makes the class to do stupid assignments. For example, he made the class look up thirty words from three articles and told us to find the HISTORY of each word!! Next, he made us look for a car in the teacher's lot with bumper stickers and made us write an essay about the slogan of one bumper sticker

Horrible teacher. Makes you do pointless crap that takes you off the main emphasis of the class which is to write. He has taken to me to the point that I hate English with a passion. DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!
